name: The Last Dance (itch)
description:
A first person horror adventure. Created for the Weekly Game Jam 145.

You suddenly find yourself being in an unknown and unsettling forest. Night is rising and you have no clue why you're here or what you should do now.

The only thing that catches your eye is a subtle light under a tree not far from you. Maybe you should check it out...

---

Still WiP. As you will see some ideas have only been roughly implemented.
Also many assets are not optimized yet so you need a good hardware setup to play it.
I will continue to improve the Game after the Jam is finished. So watch out for more to come!

Feedback is - of course - appreciated.

---

Known Issues:

  • FPS rate sucks - especially during daylight scenes in the beginning
  • Story is unfinished
  • Enemy design and AI is unfinished
  • Map design is unfinished

Game Objective:

Find a way to leave the forest.

Controls:

WSADMovementSPACEBARJumpCTRLCrouchTABInventoryLMBPick up / interact with object
RMBInspect object
FToggle flashlight (if you have one)
ESCPause / Menu

Platform:
Windows 64-bit

Installation:

Unzip the self-extracting archive to a folder of your choice on your PC by opening the downloaded .exe File. After the extraction has finished open TheLastDance.exe

Tools/Libraries used:

  • Unreal Engine 4.24 (check it out - it's free and awesome!)
    https://www.unrealengine.com/
  • Quixel Megascans (also free if used with UE4)
    https://quixel.com/megascans/home
  • SpeedTree for UE4
    https://store.speedtree.com/
  • Horror Engine for UE4 (free and absolutely awesome)
    https://www.unrealengine.com/marketplace/en-US/product/horror-engine

Music and SFX made by me. Some of the forest ambience sounds are from freesounds.org and released under a CC license - i will add the links soon.
